meanings.definition: Destines (verb): to determine the future or fate of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The wise old wizard destines the hero to defeat the evil dragon.
meanings.sent2: It is said that fate destines us to meet certain people in our lives.
meanings.sent3: The magic crystal ball destines the cat to become the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The winding road destines to lead us to new adventures and discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The ancient prophecy destines the chosen one to bring balance to the world.

meanings.definition: Destines (noun): the predetermined future or fate of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The book foretold the destinies of the characters, revealing their fates.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the destinies of the two lovers were intertwined from the start.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller's prediction about my destiny was that I would become a famous artist.
meanings.sent4: The stars aligned to reveal the destinies of the constellations in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll held the destinies of the kingdom, waiting to be unraveled by the chosen one.
